title: Best knowledge-graph AI Tools - Top Picks for 2025
metaDescription: Discover the 11 best knowledge-graph AI tools in 2025. Compare features, pricing & reviews to find the perfect tool for your needs.
introduction: Looking for the best knowledge-graph AI tools in 2025? We've analyzed hundreds of tools to bring you this curated list of the top 11 options. Whether you're a developer, business, or individual user, this guide helps you choose the right knowledge-graph AI tool.

platforms.name: Semantic Scholar
platforms.description: Semantic Scholar is an AI-powered research tool developed by the Allen Institute for AI (AI2) that uses machine learning to help scholars discover and understand scientific literature. It uniquely extracts key insights from millions of academic papers, providing features like TL;DR summaries, citation graphs, and field-specific author profiles. Its primary audience is academic researchers, students, and professionals who need to navigate vast scientific literature efficiently.
keyFeatures: Semantic search across 200+ million academic papers
Citation context analysis and influence metrics
Personalized paper recommendations feed

platforms.name: Phidata
platforms.description: Phidata is an open-source framework for building robust, stateful AI Assistants that can perform actions using tools and have long-term memory via a structured knowledge base. It enables developers to create intelligent applications with persistent context, allowing assistants to remember past interactions, learn from uploaded documents, and execute tasks like data analysis or web searches. Its unique value lies in its agentic architecture that combines LLMs with a scalable postgres-based memory system, making it ideal for building production-grade, autonomous assistants.
keyFeatures: Structured memory using PostgreSQL with pgvector for long-term conversation history
Knowledge Base with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) from uploaded documents (PDF, TXT, DOCX)
Tool calling for actions like web search, data analysis (via DuckDuckGo, SQL, Python)

platforms.name: Writer AI
platforms.description: Writer AI is an enterprise-grade generative AI platform designed to help organizations create, govern, and scale content production. Its core capability is providing a secure, full-stack AI solution that includes a custom-tuned large language model (Palmyra), a knowledge graph for brand-specific data, and tools for enforcing style, compliance, and factual accuracy. It uniquely targets regulated industries by operating on a secure, SOC 2 Type II compliant infrastructure, ensuring data privacy and mitigating the risks of public LLMs.
keyFeatures: Palmyra LLM Family: A suite of proprietary, secure large language models (e.g., Palmyra-7B, Palmyra-40B) fine-tuned for business writing and deployed in a customer's secure cloud.
Knowledge Graph Integration: Connects to internal data sources (like CRMs, wikis, style guides) to ground AI outputs in company-specific facts and terminology.
Style & Brand Guardrails: Enforces customizable style guides, tone of voice, and terminology rules across all generated content to ensure brand consistency.

platforms.name: Sintelix Extract
platforms.description: Sintelix Extract is an enterprise-grade AI platform that transforms unstructured text data from any language into structured, connected knowledge graphs. It specializes in advanced entity extraction, relationship mapping, and entity resolution to reveal hidden patterns and insights. Its unique value lies in its native multilingual processing (100+ languages) without translation, making it a powerful tool for intelligence, compliance, and research professionals dealing with global data.
keyFeatures: Multilingual Named Entity Recognition (NER) for 100+ languages
Automated knowledge graph creation with visual relationship mapping
Cross-document coreference resolution and entity disambiguation

platforms.name: Linguamatics (IQVIA)
platforms.description: Linguamatics is an enterprise-grade, NLP-based text mining platform developed by IQVIA, designed to transform unstructured text into structured, actionable insights. Its core capability is using interactive natural language processing (I2E) to rapidly query and extract precise information from vast document repositories, scientific literature, patents, and clinical notes. It is uniquely positioned for the life sciences and healthcare sectors, offering pre-built, domain-specific query libraries and ontologies that accelerate knowledge discovery, competitive intelligence, and regulatory workflows.
keyFeatures: Interactive NLP (I2E) engine for querying text with natural language or patterns
Pre-built biomedical ontologies and taxonomies (e.g., genes, diseases, chemicals)
High-speed querying across millions of documents (internal & external sources)

platforms.name: Squirrel AI
platforms.description: Squirrel AI Learning is an adaptive learning platform that uses proprietary AI algorithms to create personalized learning paths for K-12 students, primarily in China. Its core capability is deconstructing subjects into granular 'knowledge points' and using intelligent tutoring systems to diagnose gaps, predict difficulties, and deliver tailored content. What makes it unique is its heavy emphasis on MCM (Model of Thinking, Ability, and Methodology) learning theory and its large-scale deployment in physical 'learning centers' alongside its online platform.
keyFeatures: Proprietary MCM-based knowledge graph for subject decomposition
Real-time learning path adaptation based on continuous assessment
Diagnostic tests to identify precise student knowledge gaps

platforms.name: PoolParty Semantic Suite
platforms.description: PoolParty Semantic Suite is an enterprise-grade platform for building and managing semantic knowledge graphs, enabling intelligent content management and data integration. Its key capabilities include automated taxonomy and ontology management, semantic text mining, and linked data publishing, which help organizations structure unstructured data and enhance findability. It uniquely combines a robust graph database foundation with AI-powered semantic analysis, making it a leader for enterprises needing to implement FAIR data principles and sophisticated knowledge architectures.
keyFeatures: Automated taxonomy and ontology management with rule-based and ML-driven suggestions
Semantic text mining and entity extraction powered by integrated NLP services
Graph-based semantic search with faceted filtering and relevance ranking

platforms.name: TextRazor
platforms.description: TextRazor is a comprehensive natural language processing (NLP) API that extracts structured data and meaning from unstructured text. Its key capabilities include deep entity linking to knowledge bases like Wikidata, relation extraction, topic classification, and sentiment analysis, enabling applications in business intelligence, content analysis, and research. It is targeted at developers and enterprises needing high-precision, low-latency text analytics at scale, differentiating itself with a focus on disambiguation, custom rule creation, and support for multiple languages.
keyFeatures: Entity Extraction & Linking (links entities to Wikidata/DBpedia IDs)
Relation Extraction (identifies semantic relationships between entities)
Topic Tagging (classifies text into hierarchical IPTC news codes and custom categories)

platforms.name: Dandelion API
platforms.description: Dandelion API is a European-based semantic text analytics service that enables developers and businesses to extract meaning from unstructured text. Its core capabilities include entity extraction, sentiment analysis, text classification, and language detection, supporting over 100 languages. It uniquely focuses on semantic understanding and entity linking to Wikipedia/Wikidata, making it particularly strong for knowledge graph enrichment and content analysis in multilingual contexts.
keyFeatures: Named Entity Extraction with links to Wikipedia/Wikidata entries
Multilingual Sentiment Analysis (positive/negative/neutral) for sentences and documents
Text Classification into IAB or IPTC news categories

platforms.name: Glean
platforms.description: Glean is an AI-powered enterprise search and knowledge discovery platform that connects to and indexes data from all of a company's applications, documents, and databases. Its core capability is using semantic understanding and knowledge graphs to deliver highly relevant, personalized search results and proactive insights to employees, respecting individual access permissions. What makes it unique is its deep understanding of organizational context, team relationships, and work patterns to surface the right information at the right time, effectively combating information silos.
keyFeatures: Unified search across 100+ integrated SaaS apps (e.g., Slack, Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, Jira, Confluence)
Semantic search engine using a proprietary knowledge graph to understand context, synonyms, and user intent
Personalized ranking and results based on user role, team, and past activity

platforms.name: Writer
platforms.description: Writer is a full-stack generative AI platform built from the ground up for enterprise needs. It provides secure AI writing assistance, content generation, and knowledge management, powered by its own family of Palmyra LLMs. Its key differentiator is a deep focus on security, compliance, and maintaining strict brand voice consistency across all generated content, ensuring outputs are on-message and free from public LLM hallucinations.
keyFeatures: Palmyra family of custom-built, enterprise-optimized large language models (LLMs)
Brand Voice Engine that learns and enforces style, tone, and terminology guidelines
Knowledge Graph integration to ground AI responses in company-specific data and documents

verdict: All 11 knowledge-graph AI tools on this list are excellent choices, each with unique strengths. Semantic Scholar leads with academic-search, while Phidata offers ai-agents. Your best choice depends on your specific requirements, budget, and technical expertise.
